citations.narrative:
On 7/2/2023, “Joan”, a juvenile (1 year 9 month) cougar escaped from her enclosure that she shared with her sibling. The
animal was darted and secured without harm to the animal or humans. Joan and her sibling were immediately moved to a
covered enclosure. The enclosure fence is 12’ with 4’ kick-in of welded wire fencing with 4” square openings. There are
three strands of hot wire set 9” off of the fence spaced 27” apart, the lowest at about 7’ above the ground. Each strand
has a separate power control unit and were energized and functioning properly at the time of escape. The enclosure had
previously housed an adult cougar for 10 years with no incidents. No defects or damage to the fence was found at the site
of the escape.
Enclosures must be constructed to contain the animals, and to prevent injury or harm to the animals.
Corrected prior to the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
